evidence.source_document: Memorandum Opinion and Order Granting Petitioner Osorto's Ex Parte Application for Release from Immigration Custody
evidence.text: On June 18, 2025, petitioner Osorto was waiting with others, including co-petitioners Pedro Vasquez Pedermo and Issac Antonio Villegas Molina, at a Pasadena, California bus stop to be picked up for a job.

extracted.value: June 18, 2025 bus stop incident in Pasadena, California with co-petitioners Pedro Vasquez Pedermo and Issac Antonio Villegas Molina

evidence.source_document: Memorandum Opinion and Order Granting Petitioner Osorto's Ex Parte Application for Release from Immigration Custody
evidence.text: When petitioner saw federal agents approach, he tried to run but stopped when an agent pointed a taser at his head and said, "stop or I'll use it." Federal agents then handcuffed petitioner and put him in a vehicle. The federal agents arrested petitioner, but failed to show him a warrant.

extracted.value: Federal agents arrested petitioner Osorto without showing a warrant, using a taser to stop him from running

evidence.source_document: Memorandum Opinion and Order Granting Petitioner Osorto's Ex Parte Application for Release from Immigration Custody
evidence.text: Petitioner was transferred to Adelanto ICE Processing Center ("Adelanto"), where he remains.

extracted.value: Petitioner transferred to Adelanto ICE Processing Center

evidence.source_document: Memorandum Opinion and Order Granting Petitioner Osorto's Ex Parte Application for Release from Immigration Custody
evidence.text: Petitioner had a blood pressure reading of 190 and is experiencing dizziness, headaches, confusion, and burned, peeling skin.

extracted.value: Petitioner experiencing high blood pressure (190), dizziness, headaches, confusion, and burned, peeling skin

evidence.source_document: Memorandum Opinion and Order Granting Petitioner Osorto's Ex Parte Application for Release from Immigration Custody
evidence.text: Petitioner Osorto appeared at a bond hearing before an immigration judge on July 16, 2025. ... The immigration court agreed it did not have jurisdiction over a custody redetermination hearing because petitioner was subject to detention pursuant to Immigration and Nationality Act ("INA") § 235(b)(2)(A), and denied the request.

extracted.value: Immigration court denied bond hearing on July 16, 2025 due to lack of jurisdiction

evidence.source_document: Memorandum Opinion and Order Granting Petitioner Osorto's Ex Parte Application for Release from Immigration Custody
evidence.text: On July 23, 2025, the immigration court denied the parties' renewed motions for a bond hearing on the grounds that DHS failed to allege any new facts or explain how the immigration court would have jurisdiction.

extracted.value: Immigration court denied renewed bond hearing on July 23, 2025 for lack of new facts
